adjectives.sentence: The ___ atmosphere in the office made everyone uncomfortable.
adjectives.explanation: Tense means showing or causing strain and suspense.

adjectives.sentence: Her ___ behavior at the party surprised all her friends.
adjectives.explanation: Spontaneous means acting on impulse without planning.

adjectives.sentence: The ___ building had cracks in the walls and missing roof tiles.
adjectives.explanation: Deteriorating means becoming progressively worse in condition.

adjectives.sentence: This ___ wine is worth every penny of its high price.
adjectives.explanation: Exquisite means extremely beautiful and delicate, of the highest quality.

adjectives.sentence: She remained ___ throughout the entire crisis.
adjectives.explanation: Composed means calm and in control of one's emotions.

adjectives.sentence: The ___ businessman never misses an opportunity to network.
adjectives.explanation: Ambitious means having a strong desire to succeed or achieve something.

adjectives.sentence: The garden looked ___ with wilted flowers and dry soil.
adjectives.explanation: Parched means dried out with extreme dryness, especially from heat.

adjectives.sentence: The ___ fabric feels smooth and comfortable against the skin.
adjectives.explanation: Fine means of high quality, thin and delicate in texture.

adjectives.sentence: He was ___ to finally complete his PhD after six years.
adjectives.explanation: Relieved means feeling reassured and relaxed after anxiety or worry.

adjectives.sentence: The ___ scientist questions everything and never accepts things at face value.
adjectives.explanation: Skeptical means inclined to question or doubt accepted opinions.

adjectives.sentence: The actor's ___ performance brought the audience to tears.
adjectives.explanation: Moving means causing strong feelings, especially of sadness or sympathy.

adjectives.sentence: The restaurant's service is ___ with long waits and cold food.
adjectives.explanation: Substandard means below the usual or required standard or quality.

adjectives.sentence: They felt ___ when their proposal was rejected without explanation.
adjectives.explanation: Disheartened means having lost determination or confidence; discouraged.

adjectives.sentence: Her ___ attention to deadlines makes her a valuable employee.
adjectives.explanation: Conscientious means careful and diligent in one's work or duties.

adjectives.sentence: The landscape appeared ___ under the blanket of fresh snow.
adjectives.explanation: Pristine means in its original condition; unspoiled and clean.

adjectives.sentence: The ___ construction of the bridge ensures it will last for decades.
adjectives.explanation: Robust means strong and sturdy in construction.

adjectives.sentence: She was ___ by the overwhelming support from her community.
adjectives.explanation: Touched means emotionally moved or affected by something.

adjectives.sentence: The ___ leader always considers different viewpoints before deciding.
adjectives.explanation: Diplomatic means tactful in dealing with people and handling sensitive situations.

adjectives.sentence: The museum's ___ collection includes rare artifacts.
adjectives.explanation: Impressive means evoking admiration through size, quality, or skill.

adjectives.sentence: The ___ standards of this institution are recognized worldwide.
adjectives.explanation: Impeccable means in accordance with the highest standards; faultless.

adverbs.sentence: She completed the marathon ___, finishing in under three hours.
adverbs.explanation: Impressively means in a way that evokes admiration through size, quality, or skill.

adverbs.sentence: He ___ visits the dentist, only when there's a problem.
adverbs.explanation: Rarely means not often; seldom happening.

adverbs.sentence: The house was ___ damaged in the storm, requiring major repairs.
adverbs.explanation: Severely means to a great or intense degree.

adverbs.sentence: They had ___ met when they discovered they were distant relatives.
adverbs.explanation: Recently means at a time not long ago; lately.

adverbs.sentence: He answered the difficult questions ___ during the interview.
adverbs.explanation: Confidently means in a self-assured way without doubt or hesitation.

adverbs.sentence: We ___ have team meetings, about once every two weeks.
adverbs.explanation: Periodically means at regular intervals; from time to time.

adverbs.sentence: The exam was ___ difficult, beyond what anyone expected.
adverbs.explanation: Incredibly means to an extraordinary extent; extremely.

adverbs.sentence: The package should arrive ___, within the next two days.
adverbs.explanation: Shortly means in a short time; soon.

adverbs.sentence: She handled the delicate situation ___.
adverbs.explanation: Tactfully means with sensitivity and diplomacy in dealing with others.

adverbs.sentence: They ___ eat out at restaurants, maybe once a month.
adverbs.explanation: Infrequently means not often; rarely.

adverbs.sentence: The weather turned ___ cold overnight.
adverbs.explanation: Bitterly intensifies an adjective, especially regarding cold or disappointment.

adverbs.sentence: The project was completed ___, two weeks before the deadline.
adverbs.explanation: Ahead of schedule means earlier than expected or planned.

adverbs.sentence: The surgeon performed the operation ___.
adverbs.explanation: Skillfully means in a way that shows practiced ability or expertise.

adverbs.sentence: She ___ exercises, going to the gym six days a week.
adverbs.explanation: Regularly means at uniform intervals; on a consistent basis.

adverbs.sentence: The presentation was ___ well-prepared and informative.
adverbs.explanation: Thoroughly means in a complete and exhaustive manner.

adverbs.sentence: I'll call you ___ to discuss the details.
adverbs.explanation: Later means at a time in the future; afterward.

adverbs.sentence: He spoke ___ to avoid waking the sleeping baby.
adverbs.explanation: Softly means with little volume or force; gently and quietly.

adverbs.sentence: They ___ travel abroad for business.
adverbs.explanation: Frequently means regularly; many times at short intervals.

adverbs.sentence: The instructions were ___ confusing for beginners.
adverbs.explanation: Somewhat means to a moderate extent or degree; rather.

adverbs.sentence: She had ___ finished cooking when the guests arrived.
adverbs.explanation: Just means very recently; a moment ago.

collective-nouns.sentence: The company faces ___ of challenges in the current market.
collective-nouns.explanation: A host of means a large number or great quantity of things.

collective-nouns.sentence: The conference featured ___ of speakers from different industries.
collective-nouns.explanation: A diversity of means a range of different types showing variety.

collective-nouns.sentence: The investigation revealed ___ of events leading to the accident.
collective-nouns.explanation: A progression of means a sequence moving gradually from one stage to another.

collective-nouns.sentence: The archive contains ___ of historical documents from the 19th century.
collective-nouns.explanation: A repository of means a place where large quantities of things are stored.

collective-nouns.sentence: There was ___ of panic when the fire alarm sounded.
collective-nouns.explanation: A ripple of emotion means a small wave of feeling spreading through a group.

collective-nouns.sentence: The school received ___ of applications for the limited spots.
collective-nouns.explanation: An abundance of means a very large quantity; more than enough.

collective-nouns.sentence: The market sells ___ of goods from local producers.
collective-nouns.explanation: An assortment of means a miscellaneous collection of different things.

collective-nouns.sentence: The book details ___ of events that shaped modern history.
collective-nouns.explanation: A chronology of means events arranged in order of their occurrence.

collective-nouns.sentence: The exhibition displays ___ of contemporary art pieces.
collective-nouns.explanation: A compilation of means things collected together from various sources.

collective-nouns.sentence: The audience experienced ___ of joy during the performance.
collective-nouns.explanation: A swell of emotion means a gradual increase in feeling or intensity.

collective-nouns.sentence: The restaurant serves ___ of portions, enough to feed an army.
collective-nouns.explanation: A profusion of means an abundance or large quantity of something.

collective-nouns.sentence: The store stocks ___ of brands to suit every budget.
collective-nouns.explanation: A spectrum of means a broad range covering many different types.

collective-nouns.sentence: The documentary shows ___ of developments in technology.
collective-nouns.explanation: A timeline of means events displayed in chronological order.

collective-nouns.sentence: The museum features ___ of artifacts spanning centuries.
collective-nouns.explanation: An assemblage of means a collection of things gathered together.

collective-nouns.sentence: The crowd felt ___ of anticipation before the announcement.
collective-nouns.explanation: A tingle of emotion means a slight prickling sensation associated with excitement.

collective-nouns.sentence: The project generated ___ of data requiring analysis.
collective-nouns.explanation: A wealth of means a large amount or quantity of valuable things.

collective-nouns.sentence: The festival celebrates ___ of cultures through music and food.
collective-nouns.explanation: A medley of means a varied mixture or assortment of different things.

collective-nouns.sentence: The course covers ___ of topics building on each other.
collective-nouns.explanation: A cascade of means things arranged in a sequence where each triggers the next.

collective-nouns.sentence: The library houses ___ of rare manuscripts.
collective-nouns.explanation: A treasure of means a valuable collection of precious items.

collective-nouns.sentence: There was ___ of sadness in the room after the announcement.
collective-nouns.explanation: A blanket of emotion means a feeling that covers or affects everyone present.

descriptive-verbs.sentence: The detective ___ through the evidence looking for clues.
descriptive-verbs.explanation: Sifted means examined thoroughly and carefully, separating important from unimportant.

descriptive-verbs.sentence: She ___ her opinion clearly during the debate.
descriptive-verbs.explanation: Articulated means expressed an idea or feeling fluently and clearly.

descriptive-verbs.sentence: The old photograph ___ faded with yellow edges.
descriptive-verbs.explanation: Looked means appeared or seemed to be in a particular condition.

descriptive-verbs.sentence: The small startup ___ into a major corporation.
descriptive-verbs.explanation: Evolved means developed gradually into a more complex or better form.

descriptive-verbs.sentence: The fox ___ silently through the undergrowth.
descriptive-verbs.explanation: Slipped means moved smoothly, quietly, and quickly.

descriptive-verbs.sentence: He ___ his doubts about the proposed plan.
descriptive-verbs.explanation: Voiced means expressed opinions or feelings in words.

descriptive-verbs.sentence: The house ___ abandoned with boarded-up windows.
descriptive-verbs.explanation: Seemed means gave the impression of being in a particular state.

descriptive-verbs.sentence: His perspective ___ completely after traveling abroad.
descriptive-verbs.explanation: Shifted means moved or changed from one position or direction to another.

descriptive-verbs.sentence: The ballet dancer ___ gracefully across the stage.
descriptive-verbs.explanation: Glided means moved smoothly and effortlessly in a particular direction.

descriptive-verbs.sentence: The witness ___ the events in detail to the police.
descriptive-verbs.explanation: Recounted means told someone about something; gave an account of an event.

descriptive-verbs.sentence: The sky ___ orange and pink at sunset.
descriptive-verbs.explanation: Turned means changed to become a specified color.

descriptive-verbs.sentence: The technology ___ rapidly in recent years.
descriptive-verbs.explanation: Progressed means developed toward a better, more complete, or more modern state.

descriptive-verbs.sentence: The soldier ___ proudly in the military parade.
descriptive-verbs.explanation: Marched means walked with regular, measured steps in an organized way.

descriptive-verbs.sentence: She ___ her concerns in the company feedback survey.
descriptive-verbs.explanation: Outlined means gave a general description showing the main points.

descriptive-verbs.sentence: The diamond ___ brilliantly under the bright lights.
descriptive-verbs.explanation: Sparkled means shone brightly with flashes of light.

descriptive-verbs.sentence: The company's strategy ___ to meet market demands.
descriptive-verbs.explanation: Adapted means adjusted or modified to suit new conditions.

descriptive-verbs.sentence: The river ___ peacefully through the valley.
descriptive-verbs.explanation: Flowed means moved steadily and continuously in a current.

descriptive-verbs.sentence: The politician ___ his support for the new policy.
descriptive-verbs.explanation: Declared means announced something clearly, firmly, or formally.

descriptive-verbs.sentence: The building ___ impressive against the city skyline.
descriptive-verbs.explanation: Stood means was in a particular position, presenting a particular appearance.

descriptive-verbs.sentence: Interest rates ___ unexpectedly last quarter.
descriptive-verbs.explanation: Fluctuated means rose and fell irregularly in number or amount.
